page.title: 07DAIRY FARMING IN SYMINGTON
page.content: A dairy farmer was interviewed: Farming today is far better than it used to be,it's still hard work now but we have tractors,diggers,choppers, bailers and combiners.The grass in Symington is very good for dairy cattle.There are about 260 cows on the farm and another 340 at the old radio station.Our milk is sold to the Scottish Milk Marketing Board.On average we get 1650 litres from one milking time and 3300 from two.I learned to farm from my father before me.I left school at 15 to become a farmer,my son joined me at sixteen. That's what dairy farming is like in Symington today.
